website_summaries.verdict: A brand leader in the grass-seed game delivers with a fast-starting seed that thrives in extreme climates. A decent price point for bigtime grass.
pros: With a coating that protects, fertilizes, and helps absorb water, these seeds show an uncanny ability to grow in both sun and shade
A durable grass even in high-traffic areas
cons: A few customers received expired batches

customer_reviews.title: No growth and no promised refund
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two bags in March, with a freshness date of last November. Both bags were complete duds, with almost no growth. Even though weather was mild and the seed was kept moist. It was especially disappointing because I had more than 15 hours work detaching and aerating the lawn prior. Even more disappointing is the fact that I asked Scotts to honor their money back guarantee for just one of the bags and never received their promised check. Months later I called Scotts again and they said they would immediately send out another check, which also never came. I will never buy their product again.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie A McLaughlin

customer_reviews.title: As expected. Water heavily. Watch grow.
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical after reading reviews. I live zone 10- Satan's heat. We had a sand pit - a dirty, nasty, hellish pit of despair. No life at all. I overseeded* ....We have put in sprinkler system this year too, so these two things helped tremendously. Every seed took. It is nice, soft and thick. Zone 10.
customer_reviews.author: Welp.

customer_reviews.title: Expired
customer_reviews.text: Planted seed August 28th, lightly covered with topsoil and watered every day. Nothing. I checked the bag and it had dates listed by state when the seed is no good, expired. Arizona was not on the list. Anyway, nothing. Zero growth. Not one sprout. It is Sept. 10th 2018 and no sign of life. Planted in semi shaded area. Just a crap product.
customer_reviews.author: Dave  Nantz

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you only get Turf Builder. Not all Scots is the same.
customer_reviews.text: I used this to reseed an area in my front yard and the grass looks gorgeous. It's nice and thick and doesn't grow too tall . Thinking that all of Scots must be wonderful, I used Scott's landscaper mix to seed my backyard and grew nothing but garbage. I have a yard full of tall fescue that grows like crazy and looks like crabgrass . I now have to kill the grass in the backyard and reseed with Turf Builder.
customer_reviews.author: Tradewinnz

customer_reviews.title: Produces lush grass
customer_reviews.text: Before and after photos attached to show how well this grass seed has worked for us. We have had a lot of success with this grass seed in southeastern PA. Our yards are both somewhat shady, but with diligent watering this seed has produced really good results and is turning around our lawn nicely. Pros: -Produces very lush grass with the right watering and soil preparation. Cons: -Tricky to evenly spread without the help of a separate seed spreader, an additional purchase that is almost required.
customer_reviews.author: Ted GleasonTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money and time !
customer_reviews.text: I am from Seattle WA..plz don't waste your money on these seeds it won't work, I suggest to use local Pacific Topsoils primum seeds which are most effective.
customer_reviews.author: shiva

customer_reviews.title: I wish I could return this!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a few bags to help fill in an area where I had removed bushes. I cleaned the area, laid a thick area of weed and feed, top soil, then laid the seeds. I came back later and laid some more seed to be sure I had a good number of seeds. Six months later and most of the area where I had placed the seeds are all weeds. If the weeds were there below the soil, why is the rest of the grass just fine? I don't think they give you grass seeds, they are giving you weeds!
customer_reviews.author: Sunny865

customer_reviews.title: Before and After
customer_reviews.text: Better be patient, for 3 weeks NOTHING, then all of a sudden... it all came up. It started off very slow, I did end up using 2 of these bags, however the before picture was taken on June 5th and the After was taken on July 31st after being mowed twice.... still some dead spots where it just wouldn’t take... I guess you just have to be very patient with this seed...
customer_reviews.author: Stephen B

customer_reviews.title: Do not waste your time!
customer_reviews.text: Product is garbage, ordering seeds off of amazon is a terrible idea, I ordered 2 bags, within a month nothing grew, called Scott’s who advised bags were over 2 years old according to SKU on the bag and they lost germination percentage, even when I called amazon they advised just to buy direct from the supplier!
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Do not waste your money on this product
customer_reviews.text: This Scotts Turf Builder Grass Seed is junk. Down for 2 1/2 weeks and it has rained or been watered every day, I can not find one new blade of grass. Do not waste your money on this product, does not do as they say.
customer_reviews.author: MK

customer_reviews.title: Takes no knowledge and little effort for results
customer_reviews.text: I don’t understand the negative reviews for this seed because it worked great for my tiny lawn. A bunch of crabgrass did grow along with the grass but my yard already had a bunch of crabgrass so of course that would happen. I watered it twice a day for the first week during an extreme heat wave, then it rained every day for two weeks and the grass just took off. The texture is very soft and the it’s a beautiful shade of green. 10/10 will buy again to cover the spots I missed. The last picture is after being cut at the 18 day mark, roots seem to have taken well.
customer_reviews.author: LGF

customer_reviews.title: Great grass seed
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 dogs and they like to destroy my grass in the backyard. I used the seed to fill in the high traffic areas. In my backyard I have a lot of tress and a huge patio cover. So there is a lot of shade in my backyard. I just did a little prep nothing major before spreading the seed. I water once every other day but that’s because my patches don’t get a lot of sun and the dirts moist. The patches are currently covered with a lot of baby grass and it’s looking really good.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Mathers

customer_reviews.title: Awesome grass seed!
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Used all Scotts products to seed my new lawn. Seeds started to grow just after 4 days after planting. Definitely will buy again for my next project
customer_reviews.author: James B. Ruiz

customer_reviews.title: So pissed off!
customer_reviews.text: This is terrible grass seed. Used to patch front lawn. Seeded 4/28- no germination. Seeded again 5/10 - no germination. Seeded 5/15 a different area of front lawn using Vigoro Sun & Shade grass seed that had been sitting in my garage for 4- years in extreme heat and cold. The Vigoro seed germinated in 5 days and is filling in nicely. Exact same location, weather and watering schedule...just different seed! Preparing the site, watering regularly requires much time and effort. You decide if you want to roll the dice using this terrible seed.
customer_reviews.author: Michael P.

customer_reviews.title: Dead seed
customer_reviews.text: Did not grow. Put garden soil and straw and nothing. I called customer service and they firt said 2 weekks to germinate call back. Called back after 2.5 weeks was told it takes 4 weeks. It is grass seed. This is dead seed whatever makes it blue kills it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Unsatisfactory
customer_reviews.text: I slavishly purchase Scotts products because of the availability and the fact I own several Scotts spreaders. In spite of their claims the grass doesn't survive dense shade. Following their directions vigorously doesn't produce grass grown in the indicated time. The fall seeding leaves me with very little positive results year after year. I reseed in early spring relying on the spring rains and do get some positive results, but they don't the hot summer months.
customer_reviews.author: BBB

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I planted these seeds over a month now and only a few seeds took from whole bag. I’m truly upset, save your money and try different seeds
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: While searching for grass seed at Lowes I decided to give Amazon a try just to see if I could get lucky with a cheaper price. I did and even though the bag is only 3 pounds it's perfect for filling in mini spots throughout the yard, which I have/had a handful of. My guess is this bag will last most of the summer, which would be great. I've used a few different brands of grass seed and found this particular Scotts formula works extremely well.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Paolillo

customer_reviews.title: What a deal this was, $2.12/pound.
customer_reviews.text: My front lawn burned out this summer here in Syracuse. Yep, Syracuse, —quasi drought and lots of heat. So, I'm going to reseed the lawn myself. I ordered this on Saturday, started prepping the lawn on Sunday, (mowed it tight), going to rent the aerator on Monday and the over seeder on Tuesday. And of course, revisited all the YouTube vids for the umteenth time Sunday night in bed. Woke up on a beautiful Monday morning and had a "come-to-Jesus meeting with myself; I called the local sod farm. The seed arrived via USPS just as they were laying down the last piece of sod. Fortunately, Amazon let me return this the next day.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon S

customer_reviews.title: Useless. 8 weeks later they're still just blue seeds sitting in dirt
customer_reviews.text: I decided to give this a try to regrow grass in the dead spots in my lawn this spring. After prepping the areas (removing dead grass, raking the soil, etc) I spread these seeds out and followed the watering instructions. After 6 weeks they were still just bright blue seeds sitting on top of the soil (despite best efforts to mix them into the dirt), so I ran a test and used the ez lawn stuff on a few other dead spots. 2 weeks later I now have fresh grass growing in the ez lawn spots and blue seeds sitting in the dirt on the Scotts turf builder spots.
customer_reviews.author: Mimi

customer_reviews.title: Not a single seed sprouted
customer_reviews.text: I believe I did everything right... First of all, this seed is suppose to be for northern regions, and I live in the Pacific Northwest. In February I applied moss killer, then followed up by thatching my lawn. In March I fertilized and later added soil activator. On April 3, 2020 I reseeded (adding extra to bare spots) and lightly covered with potting soil. For 2 weeks I watered twice a day. At the end of that time I can't find a single seed that has sprouted. VERY disappointing. I frequently use Scott products, and have been happy with them. But I certainly won't use their grass seed again.
customer_reviews.author: Prime Time

customer_reviews.title: Danger Poison!  Product contains antifungal agent.
customer_reviews.text: I knew something was odd as soon as I saw the grass seed and it was blue. In find print the instructions state that the seeds should not be used anywhere the water could enter the water table or a drane. While they don't say it I feel sorry for any birds or other creatures that may eat it. As this is not refundable, how do I dispose of it? Scotts, the new Monsanto!
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money and time. Not one seed germinated
customer_reviews.text: I have planted grass seed many times and have had success but this particular seed has not done well. It's September 2019 in NJ and I can't see one seed that has germinated. The temperatures are in the 70's to 80's during the day and I have watered daily yet nothing. Just a bunch of blue seeds laying in the soil. Very disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: R Terrence

customer_reviews.title: Good grass seed for Minnesota
customer_reviews.text: This grass matches the native MN grass in my yard perfectly. I'm using it to overseed and fill in bare spots and it's growing very well for the most part. There are a few bare spots that I tried to seed but they haven't grown in despite following the instructions. We have very poor soil (clay, wet, poor drainage) so I've been using various top soils and grass seed starting soils so there are too many factors to blame it entirely on the seed. But, considering I used Scotts brand Turf Builder Lawn Soil on the spots that aren't growing in I am a little disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Bartlett

customer_reviews.title: hit and miss
customer_reviews.text: the first bag i bought was super. grass sprouted in the alotted time and looked great. couple weeks later bought another bag and NOTHING. The birds were not even interested. so since i dont think one can return a product that you no longer have, i would order another brand next time would have given first bag 5 second bag no (or one) i gave two. maybe you will be lucky
customer_reviews.author: happy amazoner

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money!!!
customer_reviews.text: I planted all of this seed almost 2 months ago now and less than I think 5% of it actually grew not impressed at all complete waste of money! ***UPDATE*** Now about four months in the 5% that did come up is spreading very aggressively and starting to take over the yard! I upgraded to 2 stars because of this but only 2 stars still because it was no 7-10 day germination or grass in 3 weeks as advertised. But what has come in looks very nice.
customer_reviews.author: Jason G

customer_reviews.title: Followed directions, but ...
customer_reviews.text: ... half the seeds grew. Checked several times, and still unsprouted seeds. The ones that did grow did super well. The section of lawn was new sod this season. Small 10 x 12 space. When the sod dried in a few places after being away for a week bought this. Rather than going to the store to buy more of another brand I’d used earlier in the year. I’ve still got half a bag left. In the spring I’ll try again. Plus, using in a community garden green space. Hopefully we’ll have a better yield then later this summer.
customer_reviews.author: #askmisspatience

customer_reviews.title: It grew with little effort
customer_reviews.text: Having never attempted to grow grass seed before, i literally just grabbed handfuls at a time and shook it out on the yard. My ground is mostly sand with a little bit of soil mixed in. Zero prepping the ground, zero raking afterwards, zero topsoil. It has been a semi rainy week so I only grabbed the water hose twice, put my thumb over the end and sprinkled the lawn for about 2 minutes to get the ground a little wet. Fast forward a week and I walk outside to my surprise there are 1” sprouts everywhere!
customer_reviews.author: TheGreatMonk

customer_reviews.title: Should Be Called “Weeds In A Bag”
customer_reviews.text: I have used grass seeds before and understand preparation of the lawn and soil. I used this to fill in some bare areas of my yard, which otherwise is full and weed free. The grass came in well and I kept it watered. However within a week of the seeds sprouting I found I had a thick crablike grass coming in as well. This stuff is garbage and basically ruined my yard. I realize there is some percentage of other seed in grass seed bags, but this was ridiculous.
customer_reviews.author: B. Colonna

customer_reviews.title: Nothing germinated.
customer_reviews.text: I prepped the soil in the areas I needed covered, spread seed and lightly covered with existing soil and watered daily. I am (3) weeks in and nothing has germinated. Garbage seed! I purchased here because my local for convenance, the seed at my local hardware store was half the price last year and performed perfectly. Do not trust the name, this is garbage seed.
customer_reviews.author: Hired Gun

customer_reviews.title: Grows up and fast!
customer_reviews.text: I spent a few hours clearing weeds and digging the dirt about 2 inches down to loosen it up before I put this down. Then I raked it in and watered it for two weeks solid every day. I have grass coming up. It's very thin and it looks pretty. I put it in full shade. I have no idea how long it will last or if the Texas summer heat will eventually kill it. I hope it can stay put and keep coming back.
customer_reviews.author: NL

customer_reviews.title: Grass turned brown. Twice.
customer_reviews.text: Read other recent reviews. There are many recent reviewers who experienced same problem as mine. Therefore, it is not right for this product to have older most helpful review show on top. The grass turned brown and dry, two months after seeding. Same thing happened last fall with these seeds. I live in North East and there was plenty of rain this year. I also used sprinkler. Therefore, there was no excuse for it to turn brown, when it is not even summer yet. Scotts' product is expensive and they need to resolve this problem, seriously. Otherwise, I will never use their product again.
customer_reviews.author: AC

customer_reviews.title: Not one seed germinated after two weeks
customer_reviews.text: Not one seed germinated after two weeks of faithful watering. I bought these seeds in May 2020 hoping to plant right away but was delayed and had to wait until fall. I did Roundup three weeks earlier to kill all weeds and unwanted grasses, one week to rototill, and prepared the ground. Then I spread the seed on the 1st of September, and also Scotts pre-emergent and fertilizer for new lawns as per directions. Not one seed germinated after two weeks! What did I do wrong? Update: It's the middle of October and I have a few patches of grass, maybe 10% grass growing. Now the first freeze is upon us. I'll have to reseed in the spring!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My go to seed with great results!
customer_reviews.text: I have had good results with this seed. Blends well with my existing grass. I put down in fall around September. I water once a day with hand sprayer on hose. I have also put down in late September early November and Minnesota snow covers seed before germination. Spring snow melt and seed still visible. I look back a month later with no warering and grass has germinated and grows fast. One of the best seed and forget products
customer_reviews.author: T. Kunz

customer_reviews.title: Scotts Rep Recommended
customer_reviews.text: I actually talked with a Scott's rep at Lowe's AFTER I bought this. He was telling me about another choice that would hold up against my 2 German Shepherds. I said, " Oh, I bought this 'Blue bag' already". He said that this type was their "best" and I would be just fine. Uh, Yay! 🙌
customer_reviews.author: j.ashley

customer_reviews.title: Baffled but satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I used this product to fill in bare spots of different sizes in my back yard. The product was easy to apply and directions simple to follow. The areas to be reseeded were scattered throughout my yard, some in shade areas and some in full sun. Germination wasn’t consistent, I still have bare spots in both areas. What’s puzzling is that I got good germination in one spot and none in another. This happened in both sun and shaded areas. My irrigation system is on a timer and I have good water depth throughout the yard. I also applied fungicide and insecticide prior to reseeding. Will try and reseed remaining bare spots this fall.
customer_reviews.author: S Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Grows Thick Grass
customer_reviews.text: Dogs are great but they can ruin a yard. There was a certain spot in my yard that my dog would sprint from and it was super torn up. I decided to try out this grass seed and I'm pretty happy with the results. There is a patch in the center that didn't grow because he dug a hole, but the surrounding area seemed to grow really thick grass. The seed is easy to see because of the blue color so i really coated the area during the wet days. Now I just have to fix the rest of my yard...
customer_reviews.author: Jack Varley

customer_reviews.title: Grows weeds, not grass
customer_reviews.text: It has been a while since I bought this cuz I wanted to see how the grass grew before doing a review. Well... it didn’t! I spread this all over, going to thicken up my lawn, and cover bald spots. I now have more weeds than grass growing. I’m honestly convinced that all that was in this bag was weed seed. I would not use this! Find something else that will actually grow grass. I have no idea what I’m going to do now.
customer_reviews.author: Arentje

customer_reviews.title: Defective item
customer_reviews.text: I received this grass seed and planted and it never came up. I was sick and took treatments for six months and this was the last thing on my mind. I planted it last fall and it never came up, I thought I would start to plant early this spring an it never came up. I don't have to shop on amazon again, which I have spent thousands of dollars in products. I want a refund or credit for this product. Thank you in Advance.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: First off it doesn’t come close to 2,800sqft of coverage. Because of that I had to run to Menards and grab more seed. I bought the cheapest seeds they had and look! The side yard has the cheap seeds (Schultz) which grew within a week. Scott’s was a complete waste of money. I went back and bought more of the Schultz for the back yard.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not good
customer_reviews.text: So this seed must really be for cold climates, because as soon as temps hit the 80s it started to die. The lush green grass that sprouted from this seed was nice, but it only lasted about six weeks before it eventually turned patchy and brown. Even with tri-weekly watering, there's only about 20% of my grass left. Anything over 80 degrees and this grass will die. So I do not recommend this product. It is not a 'long term' solution to a nice looking lawn. It does not withstand heat, and it isn't very dense either. I would recommend spending more on Bermuda or Zoysia grass.
customer_reviews.author: HappyBigSun

customer_reviews.title: This blue monstrosity doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: This product was pitched as easier to grow grass seed, with some kind of water-retention seed technology. It really doesn't work. I have had much more luck with organic grass seed and some old fashioned fertilizer and straw. The bag contains seeds colored in a bizarre Avatar-bright blue. So it's quite ugly and turns the lawn patches full of neon-blue specks where you rake it in. It looks quite unnatural. And it doesn't work. Three weeks later, after watering and rainfall, the little blue specks still have not sprouted at all, as far as I can tell. So much for innovation. I'm going back to old fashioned seeds.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Glueck

customer_reviews.title: Not good at all
customer_reviews.text: We have more weeds than grass. I'd say less than 1/4 of the seeds actually grew! I would not recommend. We used a different seed on a spot in the front yard and that sprouted and is lush and green, no weeds. We did the same on the 2 spots. Same weather, same watering schedule, same spreader... Only difference was the seed. We ended up using all 3 pounds on the back and it just looks terrible! We will have to dig it up and do it all again. Our neighbors even asked what seed we used in the back because it looks so bad and they wanted to avoid using it in their yard.
customer_reviews.author: Raneven

customer_reviews.title: Very poor germination rate
customer_reviews.text: This was a complete waste of money. It was a perfect time for seeding as it was cooler and rainy. I even had automatic sprinklers in place if needed. According to the date on the bag, this was fresh seed but it did not germinate very well at all, I would say maybe 10% growth. I tried for over a couple of weeks with no success. I ended up going to my local hardware store and getting some bulk seed which germinated very well and is doing fine.
customer_reviews.author: W. Schneider

customer_reviews.title: Check out the different prices on this item
customer_reviews.text: I reordered and I paid same as I paid for 2 bags and they are exactly the same size and the same seed ?? What a rip off?? Check the prices out before you pay for this item you could be paying even a lot more money if you don't watch out. Reason is that when I went to check the prices they had the same seed for way more ? I paid the last time around 6 dollars and this time I paid 13 for the same seed. ? Check it out for yourself .
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Higuchi111

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I’m not sure why so many people had poor results. I waited until there were a few consecutive days of rain to spread the seed, it covered my entire back yard (about 24 ft by 28 ft) (almost 700 square ft). There were maybe one or two areas that didn’t sprout but overall most of it took and it looks very thick and nice. Bought a second bag to catch those little spots but I will definitely be reseeding this every year to ensure I’ll keep some nice thick grass. Kept the weeds out where planted, so it’s perfect to me.
customer_reviews.author: Sham

customer_reviews.title: Bad batch? More Picky than expected?
customer_reviews.text: I've used this before and it took off and filled in some areas quite well and kept the soil soft and in place until the St. Augustine could creep in to fill it. This time around, 95% never sprouted. The area gets little sun and is often wet... but this bag says "dense shade". Maybe the bag was old? Do seeds expire? Still giving a decent rating because its worked in the past (bought locally)... but this bag was bad or its just not nearly as hearty as the sales pitch.
customer_reviews.author: D. Voo.

customer_reviews.title: It is grass seed and it grows very nicely.
customer_reviews.text: Recently moved into this home. Former owners left a large pile of brush in the back yard. Killed all the grass. After clean up, we took a regular yard rake, fingers down, adding tracks to place seed in. Another problem is shade from the neighbors trees in their yard. Some hang over also. Trimmed it back with permission. Applied seed to tracks and buried. 2 weeks it is up faintly. Product has some type of coating on it, slightly reflective. A little water in the morning. If it continues I would say 2 more weeks it should be complete.
customer_reviews.author: PC Scooter

customer_reviews.title: It grows quickly & is easily spread
customer_reviews.text: We had a valley in the center of our yard from having to fell 2 trees. So we leveled it with dirt and wanted to grow grass quickly because it was a long area that would be muddy after several rains. It’s the center of the picture & about 3’ wide & 15’ long with slightly darker grass. It was early spring and as it happens rained more than usual so I was very happy that the grass seed started to grow quickly. It grew very thick and beautiful and looks fantastic before the weather becomes hot. I wish my whole lawn looked as thick and velvety!
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: It was all weeds
customer_reviews.text: I planted the seeds, and some starter fertilizer, in an area that ranged from heavy shade to no shade near the beginning of a two week rainy spell. Little if any grass germinated, but those areas sprung up thousands of new weeds about the time the grass should have come up. All the same weed, too. I had put down a small amount of some leftover old grass seed in that same area a couple weeks earlier and it sprouted up just fine. In conclusion, I'm sure there are many variables that could be affecting my results, but I've never seen this sort of thing happen before. I am very suspicious of the bag of seeds that I used.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne V. Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Grass is beautiful
customer_reviews.text: Omg !!!! This grass seed is amazing !!! My property looked like a dried out desert !!!! Within a week my property is a lush beautiful green lawn simply outstanding product !!! I don't understand any negative review on these seeds , I honestly don't think those people took the seeds out of the bag lol !!!! I truly don't believe that their grass didn't grow !!!!! Mine is gorgeous simply gorgeous buy it you will thank me !!! My review is 100 percent REAL !!!!!
customer_reviews.author: sandra philly

customer_reviews.title: More like sprouts, not bladed grass, can't handle foot traffic
customer_reviews.text: This is your typical quick grass, will not handle foot traffic, looks more like sprouts, this is not bladed grass as far as I'm concerned. Probably be ok for spots here and there but nothing bigger than a square foot.
customer_reviews.author: t7

customer_reviews.title: Much better for shaded areas!
customer_reviews.text: This produces beautiful grass... very green and thick and draught resistant but is definitely far better for shaded areas. Sunny areas it is kind of a struggle. Even with watering multiple times a day in ideal temperatures and conditions it really needs to be covered with some kind of starter material if it's in a sunny area.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Full Sun???? Not!
customer_reviews.text: Heavy seeding of bare spots, perferated soil 2", and spread soil over with grass rake. 7 to 9 days, seed sprouted, watering twice daily, am and pm. 15 minute cycles. Grass grew about 1- 1 1/2", and then sun just burnt it up. Live in panhandle of florida. Yeah! its a hot summer, but sure expected better out come w/scotts. Before complete burn-up from sun, lightly spread straw over areas, but too late!!!!!! Will try again in early to mid fall. Not sure if I'll use scotts or not! Going to test out their return policy.
customer_reviews.author: David Buxton

customer_reviews.title: Spotty performance.  Seems to contain a lot of "filler" material.
customer_reviews.text: Be sure to follow the instructions or you won't see any grass at all. This is my second attempt using this seed mix and after following the instructions on the bag to the letter, the area I was attempting to grow grass in has seen less than 50% coverage/growth. These seeds seem very reluctant to grown in southern Michigan. I gave up and purchased seed from a tractor supply store, which required a lot less watering, grew everywhere regardless of sun/shade. I won't be buying Scotts seed mix anymore, I gave it two chances, that's all the money I'm going to waste on it.
customer_reviews.author: Martoune

customer_reviews.title: Grew in the sunny areas only
customer_reviews.text: I followed the directions but the grass only emerged in the sunny areas. None of the grass seed in the shady areas emerged. I raked the seed into the soil and eventually purchased starter soil to put over it. Just could not get it to grow in shady areas.
customer_reviews.author: tafergus

customer_reviews.title: AFTER THREE WEEKS, NOT ONE SPROUT FROM THESE DEFECTIVE SEEDS!
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst seed I have ever bought. After three weeks of tender care, great topsoil with compost, adequate watering ....not one seed has sprouted. I have never planted grass that was more dysfunctional. My bare spots are still bare, exceot for the great soil I put in them. I have NEVER seen such resistant seeds.......they may be coated for disease resistance, but they are also coated for growth resistance. I followed the directions EXACTLY on the bag......and NOTHING!!!
customer_reviews.author: S. B.

customer_reviews.title: Great grass seed
customer_reviews.text: I’ve tried planting grass seed once before with little luck, so I didn’t have high expectations this time. However, I was pleasantly surprised at how well this grew. The main reason for 4 stars is that it seems a little spotty but that could’ve been how I spread it. I would recommend it and I’m probably going to buy more myself. I did use the starter food after I planted the grass seed. My before picture is from May 7th and my after picture is May 26th. I didn’t water every day but we had a decent amount of rain. Once the weather got into the 70s and 80s the grass really seemed to grow.
customer_reviews.author: Terri

customer_reviews.title: Good and Bad
customer_reviews.text: I'm only giving this three stars because it lived up to half of it's title. It sprouted fast and seems to be growing good so far, but only in the shade. None of it is sprouting at all in the sunny area. I planted a section roughly the shape of a square, half in shade, half in sun. All the shade part is growing, none of the sun part, even though the entire squared area is watered all at the same time and in the same amount.
customer_reviews.author: Kay

customer_reviews.title: Worked for me
customer_reviews.text: I noticed some of the reviews were hit or miss in terms of performance but the seeds took for me. I just made sure to lay the seed heavy, rake the seeds under a little topsoil, and water a lot and daily for the first couple weeks. There were some bald patches but that is probably just due to shifting and not enough topsoil so I'll just add some more seeds and soil to those areas and be good to go.
customer_reviews.author: PrimeAddict

customer_reviews.title: Seeds did not germinate 😨😨😨👎🏼
customer_reviews.text: I finally sowed my seeds yesterday and posted a short video of the area before and will like to continue posting videos of at least 6 months so customers can have an idea if they want to invest in this product. I am in no way affiliated with Amazon or Scott’s. I’m doing this on my own. To be fair I want interested clients to be aware that-my review is partial since I am located in Central Florida and my soil is sandy.
customer_reviews.author: CiCi

customer_reviews.title: 1 month..still not 1 seed germinated!..4 months..
customer_reviews.text: I seeded my lawns bare spots a month ago, followed all the directions per the package - not 1 seed has germinated!! The seed is still sitting on the ground just as it looked when I first seeded..still even shows the blue coloring. DO NOT purchase this!! Believe all the other reviews stating it doesn't germinate. UPDATE: 4 months..yup still just blue dead seeds. I finally bought different seed from a big hardware depot type store..it all came up with 2 weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Seattle Siren

customer_reviews.title: Did not grow at all
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted this to work like some of the other reviews but they just did not grow at all. I gave it some time before posting my review. It has been a month now and I've been watering it everyday to keep it moist. Nothing happened to the seeds. Before spreading the seeds, I removed the weeds from my grass hoping to grow new grass. Now I'm left with all those empty patches on my lawn. It is now even worse than before when there was weed. At least it was green before. Now it is a disaster.
customer_reviews.author: Vivian I.

customer_reviews.title: I think they sent me used seeds
customer_reviews.text: Nah just kidding. In my experience there is not a better quality of seed than Scotts Turf Builder Grass Seed Sun and Shade Mix. Some may be near equal but none better. It works in Colorado, New Jersey, and in maine. The seeds do have a shelf life, even when stored unopened, dry and reasonably climate controlled you will lose viability over 6 months. At this price it is the best.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Jumps

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your time and money.  Will not flourish in Florida
customer_reviews.text: Seed germinated fairly well. Watered twice daily as recommended for a month now but new grass failed to flourish and was easily taken over by other growth, weeds, previous grasses. Maybe it’s not suitable for Florida weather. Or possibly it’s the top soil from Lowe’s that limited its growth. Don’t waste your money and more important, your time and effort on this product. It probably wise to go to a local nursery for seed.
customer_reviews.author: SAIL SRQ

customer_reviews.title: Works great if you keep it watered
customer_reviews.text: I was very surprised as how well this seed covered bare dirt in my lawn. I watered it twice a day for about a week before seeing growth. In my picture you can see growth from the first time I used it and new seeds from a 2nd use. The ground is sloped so the seeds accumulated near the fence so on my 2nd use I stomped the seeds in place a little bit. I am happy with the growth so far and hopefully the 2nd coat stays in place better.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff M.

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: This grass seed worked great in our yard. I was unsure after I first spread it in the yard, because it was my first time planting grass seed. I was not sure if I was watering too much or too little. But this seed did not take much time nor effort, and I have a flourishing yard. I watered it once a day (on days that it didn't rain) and did not walk on it for the first week or 2, and it turned out amazing!
customer_reviews.author: JBro

customer_reviews.title: Took a while, but it's growing now
customer_reviews.text: Was worried at first since it didn't seem to be taking, but it's filling in nicely now. Used for overseeding and filling in some bare spots. Took longer than the package said to start growing, but they're probably listing a germination time vs actually seeing some grass show up above ground. Either way, I'm happy, just glad I kept watering and didn't give up on it. Also use the Scotts starter fertilizer with weed control at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: joec

customer_reviews.title: Buy this now!
customer_reviews.text: We’re in Southern PA and my sister was CONVINCED no grass would grow in the backyard. Last year we bought a local brand of seed and laid it down and we still had a mud pit. We’re three weeks into me putting down this bag and it has been exciting to watch the change take over the yard. Couple of spots need a little extra help but this stuff is growing and FAST. Will likely have to buy another smaller bag for potential bare spots when it’s fully grown in but this seed is fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Linzi

customer_reviews.title: Follow the directions and you'll get good results
customer_reviews.text: I've used this seed several times. Follow the directions and you'll have good results. The last time I used this seed there was one very small spot that the seed didn't sprout...the post from our mailbox blocked the water from the sprinkler. Everywhere else grew in very nicely.
customer_reviews.author: George Blue

customer_reviews.title: Grass seed
customer_reviews.text: This is the very best grass seed I have ever used. I bought different products in past for patching bare spots. You know the "As Seen on TV" so called Grass products. I tried the roll out carpet, the liquid spray lawn, but this Scotts Grass Seed is 100% the easiest and best product I ever bought. It took 12-15 days to see NEW grass, and I didn't do anything but throw it around, and water everyday.
customer_reviews.author: david ; in Oregon

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if this does what they say. My grass is not growing. I prepared my dead spots as recommended, raked all dead grass, scored the dirt added seed and watered. Lightly twice a day first 4 days and moderately watered for next 10 days. Lawn has not greened up. It’s filled in a little. I’m hoping next spring it will look better. In the past I have mixed grass seed with top soil and spread. This worked much better. I’m disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Skarbcakes

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing purchase
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this to over seed some spots in my lawn because of some great reviews. As it turned out the germination was far from ideal. I watered the lawn according to instruction. The weather here is constantly over high 80s. Although there was some growth, most of the seeds ended up not doing anything. I am disappointed. Worst part is, since I already spread them I can not return for refund. There must be some batch difference buyer should be aware.
customer_reviews.author: Phil W

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't grow too well in shade
customer_reviews.text: I have prepped my lawn for over seeding this year and decided to go with this seed because it would match the rest of the grasses in my lawn better. So the good news is that it does germinate, albeit slow. It took over 2 weeks to see new growth. In shaded areas the growth was even slower, hopefully few more weeks of sunshine will contribute to the strength of the grasses. Would I buy it again? I'm actually a bit reluctant to purchase again at this point and in the future will go with a blend that has more KBG
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: I still have some bare spots
customer_reviews.text: I got this, because there wasn't a lawn, and then the deck was removed. We tilled several times to make sure the ground was ready, and spread according to package instructions. I am not sure why it didn't take in some places, as the soil was the same as in other areas (ph-wise, soil content, etc). I might buy it again, or make an offering to the lawn gods to ensure that I get full coverage, next time.
customer_reviews.author: GN

customer_reviews.title: Works good in shade
customer_reviews.text: So i tried to grow grass in a few large patches in my yard. I did sone testing, a plot where i dug up 2 inches of soil and a plot where i just spread the seed. Both tests grew grass, with the dog soil growing in faster and thicker. Im kind of dissapointed that this mix is "Sun and shade" but really only works good in the shade. The plot in the sun i water frequently so it doesnt become bone dry, but it still doesnt seem to want to grow. Ive even used thier grass food product, with minimum results. Overall, after a week and some days im seeing good progress on my shaded patches.
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: The Best Overall Seed I Have Found
customer_reviews.text: This stuff seems to grow well anyplace I have sown it, the grass comes up good with no extraordinary effort and looks great all summer long and all the way into the cold weather. I have a magnolia tree in my front yard and nothing grows under it except for this stuff (extra watering required there) so this is what I keep around the house for those bare spots that have to be re-seeded usually due to dogs. 5 Stars
customer_reviews.author: Douglas C. Meeks

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased, highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: This product is far superior to any other seed I've tried. Grows very fast in dense shade. Northern Florida with sandy soil and a ton of oak leaves is hard to grow grass but this stuff works. I spread it out in early May, tamped it down, spread peat moss and watered twice a day. 10 days later I've got good full growth. I'm doing small sections at a time to better control watering. Very pleased, highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Audiophile

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in the product.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the grass seed, sowed it as directed for over seeding. I’m still waiting for the seed to sprout. It’s been 12 days and no evidence of sprouting.
customer_reviews.author: Nigel

customer_reviews.title: 50% Filler
customer_reviews.text: This item is quite misleading - when I read the label it clearly states that only 50% is seed . So you actually are getting 20 lbs. of seed in a 40 lb. bag. Naturally, the coverage is very sparse if you think you are using 40 lbs. Yes, it grows and looks okay but I went out and bought perennial ryegrass at a local store that clearly said 100% seed - no fillers - what a difference!
customer_reviews.author: Kennet M. Weiss

customer_reviews.title: It works but it's not as easy as it's sold
customer_reviews.text: We had a little bald area on our lawn so we bought this throughout the year. If your grass died, you may have to start at making the dirt healthy. Simply spraying and watering did not work for me. The hard dirt underneath simply didn't let the water or seed grow in. So, it works, but you may be able to resolve the issue by properly nourishing your soil/dirt.
customer_reviews.author: K. Yagi

customer_reviews.title: No one seed sprouted!
customer_reviews.text: As others have said...zero growth. I’ve been planting grass for 50 yrs, never have I had not one seed sprout. Live in central Florida, perfect for this type grass. Followed directions to the letter. We’ve had warm weather, watered every day for 4 days then every other day since planting. Best by date was months ago, guess I should have returned it. Guess this is how vendors shed their old stock.
customer_reviews.author: superstition1

customer_reviews.title: Grows in Many Conditions
customer_reviews.text: In my experience, this seed will grow in almost any condition. I first laid it last fall, and even into some of the colder weather on the verge of freezing. Everything came in nice and lush from that planting. I laid again this spring, and once again things came up very nicely. I've recently planted in the very hot East TN summer weather, and with plenty of water things are still thriving! I highly recommend this seed if you prefer a finer blade grass that is very soft and easy to grow in a variety of conditions.
customer_reviews.author: Allison S

customer_reviews.title: Full of fungicides
customer_reviews.text: Yuck. I just spread these seeds all over my yard, not realizing they were covered in pesticides. So much for my healthy lawn. Sorry, children, birds, other critters, groundwater. I did not realize I was contaminating the earth while sowing grass seed. Too late now. The information on the fungicide ingredients is well hidden on the packaging and not to be found in the Amazon product description. I will never buy this product again.
customer_reviews.author: C. Olsen

customer_reviews.title: No growth grass seed
customer_reviews.text: I have prepared the dirt as per the instructions and still no growth. I am very disappointed as I thought that Scotts grass seed would be better but it isn't . I have been out there every day watering the seed and still no grass.
customer_reviews.author: Darlene M.

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: This product was easy to install, but it has been six weeks and all we have are weeds and little feathery pieces of grass. It is not spreading as promised and doesn’t seem to be flourishing. Total waste of time and money. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Betsy Kalapp

customer_reviews.title: Have grass in two weeks
customer_reviews.text: I put it down and kept it moist and now I have babies coming up. I hope that they continue to live. It is a mix of seeds for sun and seeds for shade so you should get results in either case. However, I would think that up to half the seeds might not make it. I was not sure whether I have mostly sun or mostly shade in this area so I bought the Sun/shade mix.
customer_reviews.author: Selim Gamer

customer_reviews.title: save your money, i only got 10 percent out of 100 percent of grass from this product.
customer_reviews.text: i usually do not write reviews, i must have received a bad batch. i waited a month giving some time and very little grass was produced from this product. do not buy and save your money. the only reason i got this is that there was little sod at the stores and were turning bad. i put this in semi shaded areas and non shaded areas and the same results and i followed directions. i would indeed like another bag to see if i really did get a bad batch as i have used for years and had no problem or i would like a refund. i will post pictures later etc.
customer_reviews.author: John W.

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: I bought a bag of this and it arrived on May 28, 2020. I spread on top of fresh bought soil. I also put a small layer of soil over the top of the seeds. I watered twice a day, every day, for two weeks. I have not seen a single blade of grass sprout. I've bought other scotts products before and after and had great results. This was NO GOOD. My recommendation, DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.author: Luke R.

customer_reviews.title: Seem to work well
customer_reviews.text: We got this to help patches in our yard where grass was not growing well. I spread it by hand and then watered it every day for two weeks and it grew grass. I got two bags of it and spread it over various places, probably pretty heavily but I wanted to make sure the patches were covered. It worked and I am pleased. I live in Kentucky and planted it May and it worked well.
customer_reviews.author: ElizabethTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Doing great so far!
customer_reviews.text: Seeded this on April 3rd; it acted as if it were doing nothing for a solid week but then suddenly on the afternoon of the 11th it was sprouting! Very cool. This is in north-central WV, where the weather is crazy and unpredictable (we had high temps, low temps, tons of sun, and at least one rainstorm in there). Was no problem keeping it uniformly moist. Since it sprouted, it has shot up a little each day. Looks great! Dare I say it...young grass is kind of cute. I keep leaning over the porch railing to look at it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: I put down the grass seed a few weeks ago over new soil during a really dry period of time here in NY. I should have put hay over it but I did not, and now it is starting to grow now that it’s been having consistent water between watering and rain. You get plenty of seed for the money and spreader easily out of the bag. I simply just sprinkled it over the large area that I had needed.
customer_reviews.author: Noah P.

customer_reviews.title: This grass seed grows fast?
customer_reviews.text: I don't have a green thumb and I've spread grass seed before and nothing happened. This grass comes up FAST. I can't believe something I planted came up. Keep it watered the first couple of weeks. I didn't dig either; I mixed potting soil and grass seed and sprinkled it on the bare spots and watered it daily at first, and it came up !!!
customer_reviews.author: Emma Love

customer_reviews.title: Good Seed at a good price with high germination %.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used Scott’s Grass for decades in four different areas of the country we have lived in. They provide a Quality Seed with a good germination %. Keep in mind the key to a good Lawn is in the quality of the soil and it’s preparation for seeding and maintaining. My key advice: take it easy on the pesticides for those little Creatures and Microbes living in the soil provide nutrients and aeration of the soil.
customer_reviews.author: Walter J. Ramsey

customer_reviews.title: Impressive grass!
customer_reviews.text: First of all, I am really impressed with this product, not only because i decided to plant grass during summer, but also because I did it on the high dessert lol. They grow really fast and it's really fun to see it grow day after day once the grass starts growing after the first week. I m very impressed and I will buy more because now that I saw that this grass does work, Ill start planting on my front yard. I will update once the whole area I'm currently planting its done.
customer_reviews.author: BjeeValzn

customer_reviews.title: Where's the grass?
customer_reviews.text: Didn't see any new grass grow from the seeds. It spread easy (maybe a little too easy; ran out of seeds before I was finished).
customer_reviews.author: Reignsupreme26

customer_reviews.title: Excellent germination and fast growing!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic germination and sprouting speed! I'm growing a patch of grass in a kiddie pool that I've filled with soil for my little tortoises to graze in. These grass seeds sprout fast and they have potent germination rates! You get a huge amount of seed in this bag, so I'll be able to keep reseeding all year. If you've got a small yard, you can seed very heavily and still have more left over for touch up areas. If you've got a large yard, you can cover the whole thing and be sure that you'll have great coverage. This brand is reliable!
customer_reviews.author: Sora Higgins

customer_reviews.title: Check, the date!
customer_reviews.text: Make sure you check the date on the package! I used this bag of seed to fill in bare spots in my lawn. Not ONE seed grew! I can only figure that it was old stock but I threw the bag away after spreading the seed. Not worth 10 cents!
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne L

customer_reviews.title: Never seems to work for me
customer_reviews.text: Have used multiple bags of this stuff over the years. Some with compulsive prep and watering, some not. Some for just little bare spots, some to seed areas cut up by sewer work, some to “overseed”. Common denominator is I have been successful in growing very little grass. For the investment in seed I would have been better off with sod.
customer_reviews.author: M. Mason

customer_reviews.title: super easy and fast!
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to grow, watered once a day in the morning. Saw sprouts within 5 days. I've never been able to grow anything in my life. I didn't prep the ground or use any fertilizer. This is in Dallas in the August heat, but my yard is very shaded. Super pleased with how easy it was. As you can tell by dates in the pic, this is only a little over 2 weeks of progress. Can't wait to see how it looks in a month or 2!
customer_reviews.author: Erin Parsons

product_meta.title: Scotts Turf Builder Grass Seed Sun & Shade Mix - Shade & Drought Resistant Grass Seed for Lawns, Aggressively Spreading Grass Seed, Seeds up to 2,800 sq. ft, 7 lb.
product_meta.description: Size:7 LBScotts Turf Builder Grass Seed Sun & Shade Mix is Scotts most versatile mix that stays green even in extreme conditions of dense shade or scorching sun. Scotts wraps each seed in a unique WaterSmart PLUS Coating that absorbs 2x more water than uncoated seed, feeds with essential nutrients, and protects seedlings from disease. Seeds up to 2,800 sq. ft. Designed for full sun and dense shade, fine bladed texture and medium to high drought resistance. Aggressively spreads to repair bare and thin spots. Grow Quicker, Thicker, Greener Grass. Guaranteed.
feature_bullets: Designed for full sun and dense shade, fine bladed texture and medium to high drought resistance
Exclusive 4 in 1 WaterSmart PLUS Coating absorbs more water, feeds with essential nutrients and protects seedlings from disease
Includes Scotts best seed, protects against disease, keeps seed moist 2x longer and feeds to jumpstart growth for thicker, greener grass
Scotts most versatile mix; stays green even in extreme conditions of dense shade or scorching sun
Aggressively spreads to repair bare and thin spots, and seeds up to 2,800 sq. ft.

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars10,310 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
